## ‚úÖ Security Features

| Item | Status | Notes |
|------|--------|-------|
| Dependabot alerts | ‚è≥ | Auto-enabled for public repos |
| Dependabot security updates | ‚è≥ | Auto-creates PRs for vulnerabilities |
| Code scanning (CodeQL) | ‚è≥ | Scans for security issues |
| Secret scanning | ‚è≥ | Auto-enabled for public repos |
| Secret scanning push protection | ‚è≥ | Prevents committing secrets |
| Private vulnerability reporting | ‚è≥ | Allows responsible disclosure |
| Security policy published | ‚úÖ | `SECURITY.md` |

## ‚úÖ Code Quality

| Item | Status | Notes |
|------|--------|-------|

| Linter configuration | ‚úÖ | golangci-lint |
| Test coverage > 70% | ‚úÖ | Enforced in CI |

## üìã Setup Instructions

### Files Already Created ‚úÖ

All necessary files have been created. You just need to configure GitHub settings.

### Manual GitHub Configuration Required ‚è≥

Follow these guides:
1. **Quick Setup**: `.github/GITHUB_SETUP_QUICK_REFERENCE.md` (5 minutes)
2. **Detailed Setup**: `.github/REPOSITORY_SETUP.md` (comprehensive guide)

### Quick Commands (requires `gh` CLI)

```bash
# Set repository description and topics
gh repo edit dynatrace-oss/dtctl \
  --description "kubectl-inspired CLI for managing Dynatrace platform resources from your terminal" \
  --add-topic dynatrace \
  --add-topic cli \
  --add-topic kubectl \
  --add-topic kubernetes \
  --add-topic devops \
  --add-topic observability \
  --add-topic golang \
  --add-topic command-line \
  --add-topic workflow-automation \
  --add-topic dql \
  --add-topic dashboards \
  --add-topic monitoring \
  --add-topic platform-engineering \
  --add-topic developer-tools

# Enable vulnerability reporting
gh repo edit dynatrace-oss/dtctl --enable-vulnerability-alerts

# Enable discussions
gh repo edit dynatrace-oss/dtctl --enable-discussions
```

## üìä Repository Health Metrics

Monitor these regularly:

### Activity Metrics
- Stars and watchers
- Fork count
- Contributors
- Open issues vs. closed
- PR merge time
- Commit frequency

### Quality Metrics
- Test coverage (target: >70%)
- CI/CD success rate
- Security vulnerabilities (target: 0)
- Code review participation
- Documentation completeness

### Community Metrics
- Discussion engagement
- Issue response time
- Community contributions
- Documentation updates

## üîÑ Maintenance Schedule

### Weekly
- [ ] Review and merge Dependabot PRs
- [ ] Triage new issues (add labels, assign)
- [ ] Respond to discussions
- [ ] Review open PRs

### Monthly
- [ ] Review documentation for accuracy
- [ ] Check CI/CD efficiency
- [ ] Update roadmap/status docs
- [ ] Analyze metrics and trends

### Quarterly
- [ ] Review security alerts and dependencies
- [ ] Update policies if needed (CoC, Security, Contributing)
- [ ] Plan next release features
- [ ] Community health check

### Yearly
- [ ] Major documentation refresh
- [ ] Review and update governance
- [ ] Annual security audit
- [ ] Retrospective and planning

## üöÄ Post-Setup Action Items

1. **Configure GitHub Settings** (15 minutes)
   - Follow `.github/GITHUB_SETUP_QUICK_REFERENCE.md`
   - Enable branch protection, security features, discussions

2. **Verify Community Standards** (2 minutes)
   - Visit: `https://github.com/dynatrace-oss/dtctl/community`
   - Ensure all items are ‚úÖ

3. **Create Initial Discussion Posts** (10 minutes)
   - Welcome post in Announcements
   - Pin important discussions
   - Set up discussion categories

4. **Announce Release** (optional)
   - Blog post or social media
   - Post in relevant communities
   - Update package managers (if applicable)
